snippet: Students at the charter schools, led by Eva S. Moskowitz, outperform their public school peers, but the schools’ methods and culture are not for everyone.
abstract: Visits to schools in Success Academy's charter network, along with interviews with current and former employees, reveal a system that is designed around achieving better results through strict demands, rules and expectations; charter school system, led by Eva S Moskowitz, is particularly polarizing in New York City, in part because of its skirmishes with teachers' union; system regularly outperforms public schools even in wealthier suburbs on standardized tests.
lead_paragraph: Students at the charter schools, led by Eva S. Moskowitz, outperform their public school peers, but the schools’ methods and culture are not for everyone.

headline.main: At Success Academy Charter Schools, High Scores and Polarizing Tactics
headline.print_headline: At Charters, High Scores and Polarizing Tactics
